title: Feeling the Distance + At Work
venues: Bolivar Art Gallery - UK School of Art
brief_description: Feeling the Distance // Kristina Estell At Work // Steve Armstrong February 15 - March 16, 2018 The Bolivar Gallery is pleased to present concurrent solo shows by artist Kristina Estell and Steve armstrong. During the run of the shows, graduating MFA students from UK’s School of Art / Visual Studies will also be presenting thesis exhibitions.
description:
Feeling the Distance // Kristina Estell

At Work // Steve Armstrong


February 15 - March 16, 2018


The Bolivar Art Gallery is pleased to present concurrent solo shows by artist Kristina Estell and Steve Armstrong. During the run of the shows, graduating MFA students from UK’s School of Art / Visual Studies will also be presenting thesis exhibitions. 


Thursday, February 15 @ 4:30- opening reception for Feeling the Distance, At Work, and MFA thesis show by Corrinne LeNeave

Friday, February 16 @ noon- gallery talk with Steve Armstrong

Thursday, March 1 @ 4:30- reception for MFA thesis show by Todd Herzberg

Friday, March 2 @ noon- gallery talk with Kristina Estell

Thursday, March 8 @ 4:30- reception for MFA thesis show by Madison Cowles Serna

Friday, March 16 @ 5- Gallery Hop

*note: The BAG will be closed during UK spring break (March 12-16) but will open for Lexington’s Gallery Hop


Feeling the Distance // Kristina Estell


Feeling the Distance is a collaborative, international mail art project that began in 2015. Twenty-

two raw drywall boxes containing a single stone were mailed to locations within the US and

around the world. This exhibition displays the round-trip results of the project revealing the

physical impact of the varied geographic journeys.


At Work // Steve Armstrong


For the past year, Armstrong has been working in the SAVS wood shop as an artist-in-residence, creating his own work while also engaging and assisting students in their art making. The artist’s work is largely figurative and often involves a kinetic element, literally animating the sculptures in the gallery space.

title: Thriving Artists Series: LEXINGTON DECONSTRUCTED
brief_description: This series is comprised of three candid conversations about the internal and external motivations for making art.
description:
This series is comprised of three candid conversations about the internal and external motivations for making art. No matter what medium you use or what your level of success may be, there are still ways to clarify your artistic vision and achieve more visibility. The UK Art Museum can help. Director Stuart Horodner will serve as facilitator for the series. 

LEXINGTON DECONSTRUCTED

Lexington is a specific place with unique opportunities and challenges. How do these affect what you make and what you think is possible? We will examine the art ecology of the city, including galleries and other exhibition venues, studio spaces, critical feedback and the culture of collecting. 

(This is not a bitch session.)

Each event is 6-8 pm at the UK Art Museum. FREE



Questions? Contact Kate Sprengnether at ksprengnether@uky.edu or 859. 257.6218

title: Lady Sings the Blues
brief_description: The Lyric Theatre is pleased to announce the extension of the Black Lens Film Series. The Winter series will feature a Diana Ross classic for its sixth film of the series, 'Lady Sings the Blues'
description:
The Lyric Theatre is pleased to announce the extension of the Black Lens Film Series. The Winter series will feature a Diana Ross classic for its sixth film of the series, "Lady Sings the Blues"


It will be featured on Thursday, February 22 starting at 7 p.m. This is a free and open to the public event! Reserve your tickets today.


The Lyric thanks Toyota Manufacturing for their generous support in making this film series possible.

title: Higher
brief_description: You know this is the best place to dance to disco in the country right?
description: You know this is the best place to dance to disco in the country right? We will turn the lights off, turn the volume up, and forget the outside world and its troubles. We do hope that you’ll join us.

title: WRFL's 30th Birthday Bash!
admission_fee: Student Tickets: $15   -    General Admission: $20 - Sunday is a free show!
brief_description: WRFL presents their 30th Birthday Bash happening March 2 through March 4 at The Burl.
description:
WRFL presents their 30th Birthday Bash happening March 2 through March 4 at The Burl. The weekend offers a chance for station alumni and current DJs to meet and share their experiences programming Lexington, Kentucky's "Only Alternative Left":


Friday, March 2nd:

Washed Out

Helado Negro

Idiot Glee


Saturday, March 3rd:

Cults

Ellie Herring

Hair Police

Devine Carama

<> After-party Time w/Thank You for Coming to Our Parties


Sunday, March 4th:

Lovely Grandmas

More TBA


Presale: A limited amount of tickets will be available for students and WRFL Alumni starting 1/15/2018 at 12:01 am

- boxoffice.uky.edu

- You will need a valid student ID to present with your ticket at the show

- Alumni Presale Code: Please see the WRFL Alumni Group for details

title: Thriving Artists Series: OPPORTUNITIES
brief_description: This series is comprised of three candid conversations about the internal and external motivations for making art.
description:
This series is comprised of three candid conversations about the internal and external motivations for making art. No matter what medium you use or what your level of success may be, there are still ways to clarify your artistic vision and achieve more visibility. The UK Art Museum can help. Director Stuart Horodner will serve as facilitator for the series. 

OPPORTUNITIES 

Opportunities are everywhere, they are taken and bestowed. Do you know what they are and how to get them? We will share strategies for finding out about what is available, focusing on regional and national possibilities and how to best take advantage of them.

Each event is 6-8 pm at the UK Art Museum. FREE



Questions? Contact Kate Sprengnether at ksprengnether@uky.edu or 859. 257.6218

title: Blood of the Wolf Fest IV
brief_description: Wolven Brotherhood and Dark Nights proudly present
description:
Wolven Brotherhood and Dark Nights proudly present:


BLOOD OF THE WOLF FEST IV


Presale tickets are now available for purchase! They will be available through the first half of March after which, entry will be at the door on a first come first serve basis until capacity is reached.


Presale tickets are WILL CALL only. The name attached to payment is what will be on the list unless otherwise noted by buyer. Valid ID required at door. Tickets are non refundable but transferable.


Entry to prefest is completely separate from the main festival admission and will be available at the door only.


Blood of the Wolf Fest will be 18 and up but will include an additional charge of $10 per day at the door for anyone under the age of 21 attending this event.


PRESALE TICKETS NOW AVAILABLE AT:

http://botwfest.bigcartel.com/
